content.title: Scheme for Establishment of Backyard Poultry Units
content.beneficiary: Poor families, small farmers, landless agricultural labourers, and other economically weaker sections of society
content.details: The scheme 'Scheme for Establishment of Backyard Poultry Units' is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana with an objective to improve the socio-economic and nutritional status of the poor families, small farmers and landless agricultural labourers, and other economically weaker sections of society. Backyard poultry is a handy small enterprise with negligible initial investment, however good economic return along with a provision for improving the nutritional status of the members of the beneficiary family through consumption of food items having high protein content like eggs and meat.
benefits: 50 chicks, 10 day old reared at Government Hatchery along with two feeders and two water drinkers are provided free of cost to each beneficiary family at their doorstep.
eligibility: The applicant should be of 18 to 55 years of age and a resident of Haryana.
There are no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.
Any applicant who has earlier availed benefits under any Departmental Scheme for the establishment of a livestock unit will not be eligible for availing benefits under the Scheme.
exclusions: Any group/firm/organization will not be permitted to apply under the Scheme, as the Scheme is individual beneficiary-oriented.
content.application_process: Online - via CSCs and Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.

faqs.question: What are the primary objectives of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objectives are to provide nutritional security to poor families, supplement their income, and improve their nutritional status through the consumption of high-protein food items like eggs and meat.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Residents of Haryana aged 18 to 55 years who have not previously availed benefits under any Departmental Scheme for the establishment of livestock units are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Are there any educational or training requirements to apply?
faqs.answer: No, there are no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements to apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: Can organizations or groups apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is designed for individual beneficiaries only, not for groups, firms, or organizations.

faqs.question: What benefits do beneficiaries receive under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries receive 50 chicks, two feeders, and two water drinkers free of cost, delivered to their doorstep.

faqs.question: How old are the chicks provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The chicks provided are 10 days old and are reared at the Government Hatchery.

faqs.question: What economic benefits can beneficiaries expect from this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries can expect good economic returns with negligible initial investment through the sale of eggs and meat.

faqs.question: Is there any cost involved for the beneficiaries to receive the chicks and equipment?
faqs.answer: No, the chicks and equipment are provided free of cost to the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Interested and eligible individuals can apply online through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Is there any other mode of application process available?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicants may submit their applications through Common Service Centres, Antodaya Kendra, Atal Sewa Kendra, e-disha Centres or any other such centre as provided by the Government from time to time.

faqs.question: How is the delivery of chicks and equipment managed?
faqs.answer: The delivery is managed by the Government Hatchery, ensuring that chicks and equipment are provided to the beneficiaries at their doorstep.
